definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Hand-made cookies. Two for the one finishes the task first.
sentences.chinese: 手製餅乾喔，第一個完成任務的可以拿兩塊。

sentences.english: Speaking for a while, Laodan raised his hand to interrupt him.
sentences.chinese: 孔子纔剛講了一會兒，老聃就舉手製止了他。

sentences.english: China has begun to make the civil code.
sentences.chinese: 中國已經開始着手製定民法典。

sentences.english: The koreans make better hand made noodles than the chinese.
sentences.chinese: 韓國人的手製面比中國人的弄得好。

sentences.english: Floral printed blouse with hand made flowers trimmed as a brooch on chest.
sentences.chinese: 全印花上衣，胸前有手製立體花作胸針裝飾。

sentences.english: Having laid the foundations of material prosperity, Solon turned to the constitution.
sentences.chinese: 在打下物質繁榮的基礎後，梭倫便着手製定憲法。

sentences.english: Hand made flower trimmed as a brooch.
sentences.chinese: 胸位有手製立體花作飾針。

sentences.english: Less clear is how to make hand-washing a norm.
sentences.chinese: 較模糊的目標是如何將洗手製定爲常規。

definition: copper (pure copper, as opposed to alloy)
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
to create/to inaugurate/to contrive/to build (a mechanism)
to concoct by mixing ingredients/to prepare according to a recipe/to make (a salad, a cocktail, cosmetics etc)
